resources.string: HUAWEI provides pioneering audio enhancement services, for immersive listening at all times. Utilize Audio Engine to enable the low-latency headset monitoring feature for your app, and enjoy thrilling karaoke on just a whim.

1. Application Scenarios

 Audio Engine provides the karaoke headset monitoring feature with open APIs to help you integrate the headset monitoring to your app, facilitating the utilization of Huawei's hardware-enabled headset monitoring capability, and achieving a low-latency and low-noise headset real-time listening experience.


1.1 Main Function 

Audio Engine provides a series of APIs for you to conveniently implement headset monitoring in a karaoke app. You can just call some APIs in the pre-processing procedure to get a better headset monitoring experience.

1.2 Realization Process \n\nAudio Engine provides the API for realizing recording in the low-latency channel, which will then be captured by the DSP and sent to codec to be played directly. This is mainly processed on the Huawei chipset and can make a great advantage of the hardware.
Make sure now that you do the preparation steps here.

4. Process Overview

To develop with Audio Engine, create a basic HwAudioKit object and use it to query the specific capabilities that the mobile phone supports.


If the capability is supported, you can create it and use it for development.


For example, if the karaoke headset monitoring capability is supported, create a specific karaoke instance, and use it to develop functions such as karaoke enabling and settings functions. When you are not using the object, release it.

5. Precautions 

You need to set restrictions to accommodate for certain circumstances.


 ● When using headset monitoring, the feature status must be initialized every time the app is accessed. Parameters such as the corresponding volume should also be configured. The app will usually automatically record the status to avoid conflict with other apps.


 ● When the app is running in the background, make sure that the headset monitoring is disabled, in order to reduce impact on other apps.


 ● To make sure other apps are not affected by headset monitoring, the system will disable headset monitoring when an app that uses the Engine is switched to the background. Once the app is opened again, you will need to retrieve the saved status again.


 ● The getSupportedFeatures() and isFeatureSupported(FeatureType type) APIs can only be used once HwAudioKi has called the initialize() API and ResultCode.AUDIO_KIT_SUCCESS has been returned in onResult of IAudioKitCabllback.


 ● The API of a sub-function can only be used after the object has been created, and the corresponding value has been returned in the onResult of IAudioKitCabllback. For example: The headset monitoring capability can only be used when the createFeature(FeatureTypetype) of HwAudioKit has been called to create an object, and ResultCode.KARAOKE_SUCCESS has been returned in onResult of IAudioKitCabllback.


 ● To obtain latency information for the first time after the phone has been reset, enable headset monitoring, then call the API for obtaining the latency information.
